It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems, and it produces a distinctive, woolly coating on its stems and leaves.
